author: AJ
text:
Don’t trust buying high dollar items from this company. 

I bought a Chanel briefcase from their site on October 13th. On October 29th, 16 days later, I finally received the briefcase. The structure of the briefcase appeared perfect in the listing and the photos associated with the listing, however, the structure of the briefcase was completely bowed in on both sides when it arrived to my house. It was also significantly caved in on the front of the briefcase. 

I took photos and reached out to their customer support within 72 hours and it took them a week to get back to me saying that the “ The experts confirmed that the article conforms to the model.” 

Their “expert quality control checks” are highly inadequate, especially for high dollar luxury brands. Their quality control review to determine whether an item is compliant with the listing or not is laughable. If the item that you received differs from the item that was advertised in the listing (even if the photos are CLEARLY different), they won’t allow you to return it. They’ll only allow you to relist it.

Also, their customer service is unresponsive. I finally heard back from them after a week and multiple follow ups from my end. 

Buyer beware!! I will never purchase from this company again. First and last time.

My update: Their customer service is horrid. It took 16 days, multiple emails from me (with a significant in delay of response from VC each time, the latest being 8 days), an eBay dispute, and a credit card dispute for them to make true to the promises on their website around items that aren’t as described in the listing. They finally offered to send me a shipping label to return the item. Don’t do business with this company unless you are extremely bored and don’t have anything more important to do then chase them down. At this point, I declined the return shipping label. I don’t want anything more to do with this crooked company and have luckily found someone outside of Vestiaire’s platform who wants to purchase the item from me (after I fully disclosed the issues I found with it). What a nightmare.
title: Don’t trust buying luxury goods from them

author: ST
text:
I discovered this site via a YouTube video, and was so excited about purchasing and buying items through this service. 
When I started creating listings, upon selecting the brand of one item, I got an automated error message that the brand was no longer being accepted.
I tried a second item, same thing. I could see that other bigger brands still worked, so I reached out to Customer Service to find out whether I could still sell the items, as I did not want them to be shipped to VC only to be told they couldn't be sold.
I did not get an answer. The agent who answered did not seem to understand the question at all, and tried to close the chat multiple times when my question was not answered. I would have included the transcript but there's no option to attach a file. 
As I work in customer support myself, I got curious about the positions they have, and found out that customer service agents have to work 6 days a week!!! See here: (links aren't allowed in reviews, so to find the job posting access the website then click About -> Join Us -> Customer Service Representative (ENG/FR))
I'm guessing (hoping) they're still managing to respect French law by giving employees longer lunch breaks, but no wonder they're terrible at their jobs if they only get one day off each week. This is shameful. I'm deleting my account and I see other reviews are only here to confirm my suspicions, this is yet another soulless company that cares neither about its employees nor its customers. 
I could not trust a company like that with my money, or my items. 
It's too bad, as this is a great concept and a well built website and app. But I also think we have to hold businesses accountable if they think they can cut corners.
title: A bad experience before even purchasing or selling anything

author: Holly
text:
DO NOT BUY FROM VESTIAIRE COLLECTIVE! They cannot be trusted. 
I recently bought a Gucci bag, upon its arrival it was much smaller than I expected so I went back onto the site to double-check the original listing. When I did this I found two listings using identical photos (both listings even had a photo of the bag with the same serial number) One was the bag I had bought and the other is a bag sold to someone else. Seeing this immediately made alarm bells ring ( how is this possible? do they not check the listings before?! Surely two listings with IDENTICAL photos show something fishy is going on?!). I had a look at some other listings for the same bag, of which all had different dimensions and different lining material. I then researched the bag online only to find that Gucci has never made a bag with these dimensions. I raised my concerns with customer service who instructed me to send that bag back to their head office. Once it arrived at their head office I was informed it has passed their "verification checks" within less than 24 hours (obviously not a very thorough check) and would be shipped back to me. No-body would answer my concerns and every person I contacted via customer service gave me a template answer. Doubting they even have real people working in customer service. The bag has now been returned to me (I have had to pay customs charges yet again) and I still have no proof that this bag is legitimate. I asked for answers time and time again only for all of my requests and questions to be ignored. All the evidence I have found proves this bag is fake. I wish I had checked their reviews online before making this purchase as it seems they are not a company who can be trusted. I am now out of pocket with only a crappy fake bag to show for it. Do yourself a favour, save your money and AVOID THIS COMPANY:
title: Fake and Terrible Customer Service

author: Simona
text:
12 days after my review on Trustpilot about a package that I never received and was stolen on the way to me, Vestiaire finally replied to my email. They refused to refund me. They have shifted all the blame on the transporter, who has also denied to take any responsibility for this mess. According to the transporter the bag 'correctly left the warehouse' and the package's weight (2.15kg) was on point - even though the recorder weight on the box was written 0.8kg (in reality was not even 0.8kg but even less) and the delivery man admitted that parcel felt empty to him when picking it up (this conversation between him and the transporting company dispatcher was recorded). 

Vestiaire have invited me to file a complaint at the police station and to thereby put on my detective hat and solve this issue by myself somehow. How ridiculous? On Vestiaire's website it clearly states 'all items are insured against theft and accidental damage' and that they 'insure and assume responsibility for all items'. Clearly they do not, as I have been denied a refund. This is false advertising and is illegal.

author: Olena
text:
Dear all, 
Item 11670075 , the issue eventually was sorted and I just got confirmation I will be getting paid.
But my point on it as I put it on email to Laura M from vestiaire customer team : 
I want to know about your KYC process and due diligence regarding billing address and different shipping address.
As out of ten items I shipped via direct shipping two had an issue, so it is 20% percent which is high.
Clearly vestiaire should start confirming shipping address if it isn’t the same as billing address by due diligence.
As in both cases it wasn’t done , as one item eventually was sent to an office address, and the other to ups pick up.
So both addresses provided on the shipping label were wrong.
And it isn’t up to seller, in my case who shipped all items within 24 hours and not a single return, to chase you and clarify addresses issues which takes and hour each time. It shouldn’t happen in the first place, should vestiaire do proper confirmations of the addresses.
Your company is relying on good sellers as sellers are the ones who pay commissions. So addresses issues should never occur!
Also on the offers which a lot of people have no problems sending but not completing the transactions.
In few occasions I even had 30% offer then initial price but then buyers tried to renegotiate another 30% percent off !!! That after first offer was accepted.
I have almost daily meaningless offers when accepted they don’t complete. These shouldn’t be allowed.
People who make offers and don’t complete when the offers are accepted should be blocked out of the system.
As I said in the past I am both buyer and seller ,
So some sort of feedback system should be placed, so buyers know if the seller is reliable and the seller knows if buyer is reliable.
Because at this rate as I said I am your loyal customer of seven years you will be loosing reliable people on your platform as more competition coming to the market.
Regards 
Olena

text:

It's now been 2 weeks where I've tried to get DHL to deliver this parcel (SF -> NYC). A week ago I alerted VC that there was problem, and Madeleine said she would reach out after 3 working days on the 11/11.
